title: Best NFL teams of the past 25 years, ranked from 25 to 1
content: With 25 NFL seasons in the books since 2000, let's pick the 25 best teams. How many Patriots, Eagles and Chiefs squads make the list?

title: Dumper's Derby: Raleigh first C to take HR crown
content: Mariners star and MLB home run leader Cal Raleigh became the first catcher to win the Home Run Derby on Monday night.

title: Scheffler's reality: Winning 'is not a fulfilling life'
content: World No. 1 golfer Scottie Scheffler said he doesn't find true fulfillment in winning: "You work your whole life to celebrate ... a few minutes. It only lasts a few minutes."

title: WNBA players, league ready for 'spicy' CBA talks
content: As the sides prepare to meet in-person Thursday, the WNBA players union and league officials seem to be far apart in early CBA negotiations.

title: Commanders to retire HOFer Art Monk's No. 81
content: Hall of Fame wide receiver Art Monk, a part of all three of Washington's Super Bowl-winning teams, will have his No. 81 retired by the Commanders on Nov. 2.

title: World's oldest marathoner hit by car, dies at 114
content: Fauja Singh, who became the oldest man to run a full marathon in 2011 at age 100, has died at age 114 after being hit by a car in his native village in Punjab.

title: Freeman set for Atlanta ovation: Will 'take it all in'
content: Freddie Freeman, who played 12 seasons with the Braves, is prepared for a warm reception from fans at the All-Star Game in Atlanta: "I think it's going to be special."

title: Portland bringing Fire name back to WNBA team
content: Portland's WNBA expansion team, to begin play in 2026, announced Tuesday that it's readopting the Fire name held by the city's WNBA team from 2000 to 2002.

title: Ex-MLB pitcher Serafini found guilty of murder
content: Former MLB pitcher Dan Serafini was found guilty of first-degree murder in the 2021 shooting that claimed the life of his father-in-law and left his mother-in-law injured.

title: The All-Stars who are halfway to history in 2025
content: Judge and Ohtani. Raleigh and PCA. Skenes and Skubal. These stars are chasing big-time milestones -- and you can watch them Tuesday night.

title: It takes a village? Inside the MLB ballpark model of the future
content: The Battery Atlanta -- site of the All-Star Game -- is an enticing blueprint. But creating a neighborhood isn't easy.

title: Ranking CFB's best coaches, from Ryan Day and Dabo Swinney to ... Rhett Lashlee?
content: Is Ryan Day a genius or could anyone win at Ohio State? We break down 20 years of sideline overachievers.

title: Before he was the best golfer of his generation, Rory McIlroy was an East Tennessee State commit
content: Fred Warren was one of the first college coaches to recruit heavily from Europe. And he nearly snagged a young McIlroy.

title: Open Championship: Ranking the 25 players with the best chance to win
content: Can Scottie Scheffler add to his major total? Is Jon Rahm headed toward big things at Royal Portrush?

title: Ranking Collier, Wilson, Clark and the best 25 players in the WNBA
content: Where do Paige Bueckers, Caitlin Clark and A'ja Wilson land? Our midseason rankings have a new No. 1 and seven new players.

title: How Clark, Fever dropped 100 points on Paige Bueckers' Wings
content: Behind 13 assists from Caitlin Clark, the Fever put five players in double figures and scored 64 first-half points.

title: World Cup lessons from Club World Cup: Extreme weather, bad traffic, kickoff times, more
content: With the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup behind us, what issues emerged this summer that need to be addressed ahead of next summer's World Cup in the U.S., Mexico and Canada? Our reporters weigh in.

title: PSG's Dembélé is the front-runner to win the Ballon d'Or -- but who actually deserves it?
content: Now that PSG have lost the Club World Cup, the 2024-25 season is officially over and we can pick the Ballon d'Or for the best player. Who really deserves it?

title: Reports: Spanish agencies want Yamal party probe
content: Spain's Ministry for Social Rights has requested an investigation into possible breaches of disability laws at Barcelona star Lamine Yamal's 18th birthday party, according to EFE.

title: Sources: Newcastle on verge of $93M Ekitike deal
content: Newcastle are on the verge of finalising an €80 million ($93.3m) deal for Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike, sources have told ESPN.

title: USMNT to play Ecuador, Australia in Oct. friendlies
content: The United States will play Venezuela and Australia in a pair of friendlies in October as part of its preparation for the 2026 World Cup, U.S. Soccer announced on Monday.

title: Chelsea's Colwill: CWC will be bigger than UCL
content: Chelsea's Levi Colwill has said his side is ready to win the Premier League and Champions League after they won the Club World Cup.

title: Arsenal target Mosquera confirms Valencia exit
content: Arsenal target Cristhian Mosquera has appeared to confirm his Valencia departure, claiming he is leaving "home" to begin a "new era."

title: Real Madrid sign left-back Carreras from Benfica
content: Real Madrid have signed Benfica left-back Álvaro Carreras for €50 million ($58.44m), it was announced on Monday.

title: Euro 2025 group games draw record crowds
content: The group stage of the Women's European Championship which finished on Sunday had record-breaking attendances with close to half a million fans attending games.

title: Modric joins Milan after 13 seasons at Madrid
content: At age 39, Luka Modric is going to try to help restore seven-time European champion AC Milan to glory after one of the most disappointing Rossoneri seasons in recent memory.

title: Euro 2025 Power Rankings: Spain still the favorite, England a close second
content: Euro 2025 is down to the final eight teams who have the chance to get their hands on the trophy in Switzerland. We ranked them in order.

title: Year 2 player spotlight: Maye, Harrison, Odunze among popular breakouts
content: The ESPN Fantasy staff lists NFL sophomores who are undervalued in drafts and others who are under scrutiny.

title: The Jannik Sinner-Carlos Alcaraz rivalry is one for the ages
content: On Sunday, Sinner defeated Alcaraz for the Wimbledon title -- the latest in a back-and-forth rivalry that will continue to entertain.

title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
content: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.

title: Court reserves verdict on Baramulla MP’s plea for interim bail to attend Parliament
content: The National Investigation Agency opposed the plea by Sheikh Abdul Rashid alias ‘Engineer’ Rashid, and said interim bail should not be granted

title: Sinking of MSC Elsa 3: Kerala HC admits PILs seeking compensation
content: Division Bench post the case for hearing in September, considering that a Single Bench is hearing an Admiralty suit filed by the State government

title: Seven dead, 17 injured as passenger vehicle falls into gorge in J&K's Doda
content: The accident took place on the Doda-Bharth road near Ponda, some 30 km from Doda town, when the driver of a tempo traveller lost control while negotiating a blind curve around 9 a.m., officials said

title: HC deadline ends, but relief eludes motorists on NH 544
content: Despite HC warning, no progress on Edappally–Mannuthy NH repairs; toll collection sparks fury amid crumbling road conditions

title: With local body polls knocking on the doors, opposing fronts in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation sharpen their attack on rivals
content: Even as the LDF and the BJP appear to be planning to go ahead with more protests, the UDF has not really made its presence felt, reflective of its diminished numbers in the council

title: Monsoon conditions pick up over Kerala; places at risk include hilly regions
content: North and central Kerala will have some intense spells of rain compared to the rest of State for the next week

title: Administrative tussle continues at Kerala University; SFI holds demonstration at university headquarters
content: Amid persisting stand-off, the university remains caught in worrying administrative stalemate with several crucial files, including degree and equivalency certificate applications and Plan fund release requests, pending clearance

title: SCR awaits A.P’s share to resume Kovvur–Bhadrachalam rail project
content: SCR General Manager Sanjay Kumar Srivastava promised to invite tenders for the ₹271-crore Rajahmundry railway station modernisation project within a week

title: Alprazolam found in Kukatpally toddy samples, several continue to battle for life
content: The alprozalam-laced toddy, sold at shops in Hydernagar, Shamshiguda, and SP Nagar, has so far claimed nine lives and left at least 50 others seriously ill

title: Bangladesh Government To Demolish Satyajit Ray's Ancestral Home In Dhaka, Mamata Banerjee Seeks Centre's Intervention
content: Eminent filmmaker Satyajit Ray's ancestral home in Dhaka is being demolished by Bangladeshi authorities, said West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday.

title: Political Parties Relying On Caste Considerations Dangerous For Country: Supreme Court
content: Political parties relying on caste considerations are equally dangerous for the country, the Supreme Court observed on Tuesday as it refused to entertain a plea seeking cancellation of the registration of the All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (A

title: "Misleading": Health Ministry On Warning Labels For Samosas, Jalebis
content: The Union Health Ministry on Tuesday termed reports claiming it has directed vendors to put warning labels on food items such as samosas, jalebis and laddos as "misleading, incorrect, and baseless".

title: 'Will Replace Big Politicians': Reham Khan Launches New Political Party In Pakistan
content: In a new development, Reham Khan, journalist and former wife of PTI founder Imran Khan, has announced the launch of her own political party called Pakistan Republic Party, marking her formal entry into politics.

title: Suspend Cop Who Did Not Act In SC/ST Act Case: Madras High Court
content: The Madras High Court has ordered the Director General of Police to suspend the Deputy Superintendent of Police of Kottakuppam range for failing to take appropriate action in a case filed under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

title: Man Sentenced To Life For Sexually Assaulting Pregnant Woman On Train
content: A court in Tamil Nadu has sentenced a man to life imprisonment till death for the sexual assault and attempted murder of a four-month pregnant woman aboard a moving train earlier this year.

title: "Rich People": Pune Porsche Victim's Father On "Juvenile" Tag To Accused
content: The decision of the Juvenile Justice Board that the main accused in the Pune Porsche crash case will be tried as a juvenile and not an adult - is just another example of money and power at play, said the fathers of the software professionals who died

title: "Happy, Relieved": Husband Of Kerala Nurse As Yemen Pauses Her Execution
content: Yemeni authorities postponing the execution of Kerala nurse Nimisha Priya has brought relief to the family of the death row prisoner, with her husband expressing satisfaction over the collective effort made by government and other organisations.

title: "Our Country Going Through Amrit Kaal": President Murmu
content: President Droupadi Murmu said on Tuesday said making India a developed nation by the year 2047 is the government's national goal.

title: 'Not Irrational, Arbitrary': Jetty Near Gateway Of India Cleared By High Court
content: In a major boost for Mumbai's coastal infrastructure, the Bombay High Court on Tuesday dismissed a series of public interest litigations challenging the construction of a passenger jetty and terminal near the iconic Gateway of India.

title: S Jaishankar's Sharp Message On Terrorism In First China Visit In 5 Years
content: Foreign Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday raised the issue of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam at the meeting of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Council in Tianjin.

title: "Can You Hit Moscow?" Trump Asked Zelensky To Make Putin "Feel The Pain"
content: US President Donald Trump has said he's "disappointed but not done" with his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, who is showing no signs of ending the war in Ukraine.

title: "This Is All Jihad": Zohran Mamdani's Ex-Intern On Protests Against Israel
content: A former intern for New York mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani has described political activism as "jihad" and urged Muslims to risk getting suspended or arrested while standing up to "settler colonialism."

title: On Assam Eviction Drives, Himanta Sarma Points To "Demographic Shift"
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday defended the state's ongoing eviction drives, stating it is essential to curb illegal encroachment, and warned the indigenous people about a growing demographic shift in the Upper Assam region.

title: How Irish Man Was Jailed In US For Months After Overstaying Visa By 3 Days
content: A 35-year-old Irish tech worker and father of three was detained by the Immigration and Customs Enforcement for overstaying in the United States for 3 days.

title: Samay Raina Gives Written Apology To Women's Panel Over Sexist Remarks
content: Comedian Samay Raina, who appeared before the National Commission for Women over his alleged offensive and sexist remarks during his show 'India's Got Latent', has submitted a written apology to the panel today.

title: "Hearty Welcome": President Murmu As Shubhanshu Shukla Returns To Earth
content: President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday congratulated Shubhanshu Shukla as he returned to Earth after his 20-day space sojourn, and said his role in piloting Axiom Mission 4 to the International Space Station has created a new milestone for

title: From Police Station, Rajasthan MLA Dials Civic Officials: "Will Break Your Heads"
content: Jaipur's BJP MLA from Hawa Mahal, Bal Mukund Acharya, is making headlines once again -- this time for occupying a police officer's chair inside the police station in Jaipur's communally sensitive area of Ramganj police station.

title: Living With Lover, UP Woman Strangles 5-Year-Old Daughter, Blames Husband
content: A woman, living with her lover, has been arrested for strangling her five-year-old daughter at her Lucknow home late on Monday night and then pinning the blame on her husband, said the police.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United linked with Lyon midfielder Tolisso
content: Lyon midfielder Corentin Tolisso has emerged as a transfer target for Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Tillman to Leverkusen: Can USMNT star fill void left by Wirtz?
content: Malik Tillman is coming off a career year and Bayer Leverkusen are in transition. Is this a perfect match?

title: Unstoppable Lionel Messi has Miami back on top
content: Lionel Messi registered his fifth straight multigoal game, propelling Miami to the top of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: CM responsible for food poisoning, student deaths in residential schools, alleges KTR
content: The BRS working president requests CM Revanth Reddy to take the incidents seriously, hold review meet

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu to inaugurate summit on green hydrogen at SRM University-AP on July 18
content: The summit will focus on research and development, innovation, commercialisation, and alignment with the National Hydrogen Mission, and discuss the policy framework and incentives to support hydrogen projects

title: Fisherfolk in Tharangambadi villages hit by irregular drinking water supply
content: Officials say a ₹2,200-crore proposal under the Jal Jeevan Mission is yet to be approved and efforts were on to improve the clean water supply in the region

title: Supreme Court decides to wait a day for Kerala government’s take on KEAM 2025 revised rank list
content: The Bench made it clear that the court’s interference would be minimal and based on legal principles and not on facts

title: Bureaucratic hurdles delay Kendriya Vidyalaya project at Thengode
content: Civic body awaits approval from Revenue department as land is classified as ‘puramboke kulam’ (pond) in tax records

title: Devanahalli farmers’ 1,198-day struggle and its impact could set a precedent
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah describes the farmers’ protest as ‘historic’ while announcing the decision to shelve the land acquisition process

title: 14 deer die at Pune zoo over five days, probe on: officials
content: A Pune Municipal Corporation veterinary officer said authorities are examining various possibilities, including infection through the deer feed to identify the cause behind the fatalities

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. drops all proceedings against retired IPS officer Venkateswara Rao
content: The decision follows the quashing of an FIR and chargesheet filed by the ACB by the High Court of Andhra Pradesh

title: CBI books railway officials for corruption in Gati Shakti project
content: The central probe agency has cited instances of alleged corruption in the Lucknow and Varanasi offices of the Railways in the centre's flagship project, Gati Shakti

title: Legislation banning black magic under consideration,  State govt. tells Kerala HC
content: The government had submitted before the High Court in June that it would not proceed to enact a law to superstitious practices, citing a policy decision made by the State Cabinet

title: Draft Bill proposes anti-ragging cells in all educational institutions, police stations in Kerala
content: The draft legislation specifies that the head of the institution shall within 24 hours of receiving information or a complaint about ragging determine whether a prima facie case is made out for registering an FIR and further action. Subsequently, the student accused of ragging shall be suspended forthwith

title: Stakeholders want State as a unit, not district, for implementation of free bus ride for women in Andhra Pradesh
content: It will ensure smoother coordination and reduce the risk of misuse, or logistical bottlenecks, say officials; the Chief Minister will take a final call on the issue, asserts Transport Minister Ramprasad Reddy, adding that the government is in the process of procuring 2,000 new buses to augment the existing fleet and support the anticipated surge in passengers

title: 14 ditch bridges constructed under MGNREGA in two gram panchayats of Bidar district
content: These drainage ditch bridges along agricultural fields built as part of Namma Grama, Namma Raste project has come as boon to farmers

title: Land identified for setting up maintenance facility for Vande Bharat coaches in Tiruchi
content: About 30 acres of land near the upcoming Mainline Electric Multiple Unity shed near Manjathidal has been identified by the Golden Rock Railway Workshop authorities

title: Additional school hours: Samastha to offer practical suggestions during talks with govt.
content: Additional working hours for Classes VIII to X, 15 minutes each in the morning and afternoon on all days except Fridays, would affect students who attend ‘madrasa’ classes early in the morning, it says

title: BIS raids Flipkart, E-Kart, Meesho, Amazon warehouses
content: Teams seize about 25 categories of consumer products, including LED bulbs, toys, electronic material and table fans, which lack mandatory BIS certification or the Compulsory Registration Scheme

title: There’s no concept of clearing projects based on floodwaters, says MoJS ex-Advisor
content: Sriram Vedire observes that allowing projects based on floodwaters would stir up a hornet’s nest as every basin State could try to avail it leading to problems in deficit years

title: Satheesan slams government for throwing State’s higher education sector into ‘disarray’
content: Under the LDF government, several postgraduate courses have been discontinued, while several degree courses did not have any takers, he says

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Duty-free import policy has hit red gram farmers in State, says Minister
content: In 2024-25, India imported more than 13 lakh tonnes of red gram and MoUs have been signed with countries like Mozambique to import additional two lakh tonnes, according to Priyank Kharge

title: 'Can you hit Moscow?' Trump asks Zelenskyy to strike deep inside Russia
content: In a notable shift, Donald Trump reportedly urged Volodymyr Zelenskyy to intensify strikes within Russia, even inquiring about Ukraine's capacity to hit Moscow and St. Petersburg with the right weaponry. This conversation, following a tense exchange with Vladimir Putin, signals growing US frustration with Russia's refusal to negotiate and a potential move towards more aggressive tactics to pressure the Kremlin.

title: 'Combat 3 evils': India's stern message on terrorism at SCO meet in China
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar addressed the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation meeting. He stated the SCO must be uncompromising on terrorism. Jaishankar highlighted the Pahalgam attack and India's response. He reminded the SCO of its founding principles against terrorism, separatism, and extremism. He also emphasized mutual respect and territorial integrity within the SCO.

title: Golden Temple receives second bomb threat; security heightened
content: The Golden Temple in Amritsar received a second bomb threat within 24 hours, prompting heightened security measures. The SGPC reported the email to police, condemning it as an attempt to disrupt communal harmony. Authorities are investigating the digital footprints, with both central and state agencies collaborating.

title: King Charles III meets Team India, inquires about Akash Deep's cancer-stricken sister
content: King Charles III hosted the Indian men's and women's cricket teams at St. James's Palace in London, engaging in personal conversations with players and coaches. He inquired about Akash Deep's sister's health and even recalled details of the Lord's Test, including Mohammed Siraj's unfortunate dismissal.

title: Obama has two words for Democrats who want to beat Trump
content: “We need less whining and fewer people in fetal positions,” Obama said, delivering a rhetorical slap to the Democratic intelligentsia who have responded to Trump’s second coming with a blend of despair, hedging, and awkward silence. In other words, the man who once asked you to dream big is now begging you to grow a spine.

title: Tesla India launch: Anand Mahindra's message to Elon Musk; says ‘Meet you at …’
content: Anand Mahindra welcomed Elon Musk and Tesla to India as the EV company officially debuted with its first showroom, the Tesla Experience Centre, in Mumbai. Mahindra expressed optimism and acknowledged the competition Tesla brings to India's growing EV sector. Tesla has launched its Model Y in India, with prices starting at Rs 61 lakh.

title: Odisha student sets self ablaze over 'harassment': UGC sets up 4-member panel
content: Following the tragic self-immolation of a B.Ed student in Balasore, Odisha, the UGC has formed a four-member fact-finding committee. This panel will investigate the circumstances surrounding the incident, including allegations of sexual harassment against the head of the education department. The committee will also assess the college's compliance with regulations and recommend preventive measures.

title: 'Dismantle this network': Canada's Alberta seeks terror tag for Bishnoi gang
content: A second Canadian province has formally urged the Country's federal government to declare the Lawrence Bishnoi gang a terrorist organisation, a move that could strengthen India’s case for extradition and action against wanted gangsters like Goldy Brar.

title: 'Denial of preferred food to prisoners not rights violation,' says SC; flags disability gaps in jails
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that denying prisoners, including those with disabilities, preferred food items does not violate fundamental rights, emphasizing adequate and nutritious food is sufficient. The court highlighted the need for prison reforms, especially concerning disability-sensitive infrastructure and healthcare, while acknowledging outdated prison manuals and the state's obligation to protect disabled prisoners' rights.

title: Dell CEO on Meta’s hiring spree: Says AI hiring may backfire; warns of 'complaining employees;
content: Dell CEO Michael Dell has cautioned Meta about potential internal cultural clashes arising from its aggressive AI talent acquisition strategy. Dell highlighted that offering inflated salaries to new AI hires from companies like Google DeepMind and OpenAI could breed discontent among existing Meta employees.

title: Cricket: Big update on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's ODI future - Full story here
content: Amidst speculation about Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's ODI future, BCCI Vice-President Rajeev Shukla clarified that both players remain available for the format. This statement follows their T20I retirement after the 2024 World Cup win and their departure from Test cricket.

title: 'Will cope': Russia hits back at Trump's ultimatum, sanctions threat
content: The Kremlin acknowledged the gravity of Trump's 50-day ultimatum for a Ukraine peace deal, requiring time to analyze the proposal. Moscow expressed openness to discussing the timing of further negotiations with Ukraine, despite previous talks failing to yield progress.

title: AI war: Zuckerberg ups the ante; offers Rs 1,600cr to Apple AI exec; here's who he is
content: Mark Zuckerberg is building a Superintelligence Lab, offering record-breaking salaries up to Rs 1,600 crore to attract top AI talent from companies like Apple, OpenAI, and Google DeepMind. This initiative aims to unify Meta's AI projects and accelerate the development of superintelligence, surpassing artificial general intelligence. Meta's aggressive recruitment signals an intensified AI talent war in Silicon Valley.

title: TOI journalist attacked in London: 'Alone at midnight after Lord's Test, I faced the scariest moment of my life'
content: TOI Sports reporter Sahil Malhotra, who is covering the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy in London faced a terrifying encounter after midnight near Northwick Park Station. Approached by five masked men, he narrowly escaped a potential mugging by using his tripod as a weapon and fleeing.

title: No warnings for samosas, jalebis: PIB issues statement; calls claims fake
content: Press Information Bureau refuted claims about health ministry's advisory. The advisory was about warning labels on Indian snacks like samosas and jalebi. PIB clarified it was a general advisory. It aimed to make people aware of hidden fats and sugar in all food products. The advisory encourages healthier choices at workplaces. It does not target Indian street food culture.

title: Rookie cheerleader Cooper Maas quickly becomes Cowboys fan favorite
content: Cooper Maas, recognised for her role in 'Reacher', now shines as a Dallas Cowboys cheerleader. Her Instagram posts about resilience resonate with fans. Maas's journey inspires many. The Cowboys also announced cheer squad leaders Kleine Powell, Anna Kate Sundvold, and Karley Swindell. While the Cowboys aim for playoffs, Maas's popularity offers a refreshing story. Her story is winning hearts.

title: When will the Fortnite servers come back online after v36.20 downtime?
content: Fortnite servers went down as of 4 AM ET on July 15 for patch v36.20, and the downtime is expected to last for 2–4 hours. Players can expect the servers to return from 6–8 AM ET. The update brings with it superhero content including a Superman crossover, Blitz Royale, and Boom Bonanza event.

title: NHL trade buzz: McDavid weighs Oilers loyalty; eyes free agency freedom
content: Elliotte Friedman suggests Connor McDavid is likely to sign a contract extension with the Edmonton Oilers, securing his future with the team beyond the 2025-26 season. Despite recent playoff heartbreaks and speculation about McDavid exploring free agency, the Oilers' captain seems committed to chasing a Stanley Cup in Edmonton. Negotiations for a lucrative contract extension are expected.

title: 'Shubman Gill vs Zak Crawley clash reason behind India's Lord's defeat'
content: Following India's 22-run defeat to England at Lord's, former cricketer Mohammad Kaif criticized Shubman Gill's on-field confrontation with Zak Crawley. Kaif believes the incident ignited England's comeback, particularly inspiring captain Ben Stokes. Tensions flared on the third day, culminating in heated exchanges between players. England ultimately won, taking a 2-1 series lead. The fourth Test begins July 23.

title: Julie Cousins sobs as Falcons bench Kirk in Netflix’s ‘Quarterback’
content: In Netflix's Quarterback Season 2, Julie Cousins shares the emotional impact of Kirk Cousins being benched for Michael Penix Jr. Despite the difficult news, Kirk displayed remarkable grace by calling Penix to congratulate him. This act of empathy resonated with fans, highlighting the Cousins' resilience and Kirk's exceptional character amidst a challenging transition within the Atlanta Falcons.

title: 'Jadeja was hoping against hope, the real star was Bumrah': Ex-India cricketer after India's Lord's defeat
content: Sanjay Manjrekar highlights KL Rahul's consistent performance as a major positive for India, praising his improved technique and temperament. He also acknowledged Jasprit Bumrah's resilience with the bat during a crucial partnership with Ravindra Jadeja at Lord's. Manjrekar further lauded Bumrah's adaptability and impact with the ball across both innings, solidifying his legacy as a versatile player.

title: Tesla drives into India:Musk's EV giant opens first showroom in Mumbai- top 10 things to know
content: Tesla has officially entered the Indian market, opening its first showroom in Mumbai and displaying two Model Y vehicles. While deliveries are expected to begin after September 2025, the company plans to establish charging infrastructure and expand to Delhi. This move comes amid declining global sales for Tesla, offering a fresh opportunity in India's growing EV market.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: Security breach at building housing Kriti Sanon,KL Rahul; and more
content: Security was breached at Pali hill building housing Kriti Sanon and others. Sameer Wankhede spoke about online bullying after Aryan Khan's case. Nawazuddin Siddiqui's daughter, Shora, impressed with her acting. Sonam Kapoor defended Indian presence at Wimbledon. Manoj Bajpayee confirmed 'The Family Man Season 3' is coming soon. Jaideep Ahlawat will also play a major role in the series.

title: Caitlin Clark and Tyrese Haliburton react to Johnny Furphy’s reel dunk
content: Johnny Furphy's electrifying dunk over Noa Essengue in a recent game has ignited excitement among Indiana Pacers fans and NBA stars alike. Tyrese Haliburton and Caitlin Clark lauded the play, fueling demands for increased playing time for Furphy. Amidst the enthusiasm, fans also expressed concern for Haliburton's recovery from Achilles' surgery, hoping for his speedy return to the court.

title: Rishabh Pant's pain: Run-out controversy, 9 runs, and emotional message
content: England clinched a narrow 22-run victory over India in a thrilling third Test at Lord's, taking a 2-1 series lead. Despite a late resistance from Jadeja and Siraj, India fell short of the 193-run target. Gill highlighted Pant's earlier run-out as a crucial turning point, impacting India's potential first-innings lead and ultimately contributing to the defeat.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Really annoying...' — King Charles III sympathises with India
content: Following a narrow defeat in the third Test match against England, King Charles III hosted and consoled the Indian cricket team at Clarence House. He expressed his sympathy to captain Shubman Gill regarding the unfortunate dismissal of Mohammed Siraj. The King also met with the Indian women's team, who recently secured their first-ever T20I series win against England.

title: Netanyahu orders IDF to hit Syrian forces in Sweida; cites threat to Druze community
content: Following reports of an attack on Sweida, Israel struck Syrian military vehicles in the area. This action comes after Prime Minister Netanyahu declared the need to immediately strike regime forces operating against the Druze population. Druze leaders initially called for armed factions to surrender, but a subsequent retraction highlighted broken promises and continued shelling of civilians.

title: Rahul's dig at Jaishankar 'apprising' China's Xi; calls it 'full-blown circus'
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar for briefing Chinese President Xi Jinping on India-China relations, calling it a "full-blown circus." Jaishankar met with Xi and other Chinese officials to discuss bilateral ties, emphasizing mutual respect and addressing border issues. He also conveyed greetings from Indian leaders and expressed optimism for improved relations.

title: Who is WNBA star Candace Parker's wife Anna Petrakova?
content: Candace Parker, who retired from the WNBA in 2023, is married to Anna Petrakova, a former Russian basketball player. They are raising their children, including Parker's daughter from a previous marriage and their two young sons. Parker playfully envisions her sons being drafted into the NBA in the future, highlighting their strengths and weaknesses in a humorous Instagram post.

title: 'Inspired a billion dreams': PM Modi hails Shubhanshu Shukla's 'courage'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Shubhanshu Shukla's return to Earth after his historic mission to the International Space Station, marking a significant milestone for India's space program. Union Minister Jitendra Singh also hailed Shukla's successful voyage as a moment of pride and glory for India. Shukla returned safely aboard the Dragon capsule, carrying valuable cargo and experiments.

title: IND vs ENG: Shades of Dhoni in Jadeja - England cricketer draws comparison
content: Jos Buttler lauded Ravindra Jadeja's resilient batting during India's chase at Lord's, drawing parallels to MS Dhoni's calm and persistent approach. Buttler highlighted Jadeja's fighting spirit and ability to handle pressure, noting his unwavering faith in tail-enders Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj. He admired Jadeja's clear plan and the trust he instilled in his partners, even if unconventional.

title: 'Designed to ride elevators, board trains': China deploys robots for delivery
content: Shenzhen has launched a pioneering initiative using autonomous robots to restock 7-Eleven stores within its subway system. Operated by VX Logistics, these robots navigate elevators, platforms, and trains during off-peak hours to deliver goods. This innovative system aims to alleviate logistical challenges for store staff, replacing manual deliveries.

title: India’s June trade deficit narrows to $18.78 billion, services surplus stays strong
content: India's merchandise trade deficit narrowed to $18.78 billion in June, surpassing market forecasts and improving from May's figures, driven by decreased exports and imports. Merchandise exports reached $35.14 billion, while imports totaled $53.92 billion. The services sector contributed a strong surplus of $15.62 billion, with exports at $32.84 billion and imports at $17.58 billion.

title: Kerala nurse death row: Big relief for Nimisha Priya in Yemen; execution postponed
content: Yemeni authorities have delayed the execution of Nimisha Priya, a Kerala nurse convicted of murder, originally scheduled for July 16. The Indian government has increased its efforts to allow Priya's family more time to negotiate a resolution with the victim's family. Priya was convicted in 2020 for the murder of her business partner.

title: What happened to Eugenia Cooney after being AWOL in a livestream?
content: After a worrying live stream in May 2025, Eugenia Cooney has sparked a speculation of a death hoax, after she went radio silent, aided by a Meta AI summary and an alleged claim by a neighbour. However, there have been no any official confirmations, and fans are cautioned not to spread speculation and to wait until there is an actual update.

title: Eugenia Cooney death rumor resurfaces, AI content fueling up confusion
content: Social media is abuzz with rumors of Eugenia Cooney's death, fueled by AI-generated content and unverified claims. A Meta AI summary falsely stated her passing, while a TikTok user claiming to be a neighbor alleged witnessing an ambulance at her residence. However, fans express skepticism, citing the lack of credible sources and Cooney's history of social media breaks.

title: Director Pandiraj on deciding to not work with Vijay Sethupathi
content: National Award-winning director Pandiraj, whose upcoming family entertainer Thalaivan Thalaivi features actor Vijay Sethupathi and Nithya Menen in the lead, has now disclosed how, before this film, both Vijay Sethupathi and he had decided that they would never work together ever in their lives because of a difference of opinion.

title: CoryxKenshin scandal: Ex accuses YouTuber of abuse, manipulation on TikTok
content: Popular YouTuber CoryxKenshin faces serious allegations from TikTok user @pandaninjaxxofficial, who detailed a harmful relationship involving emotional abuse and manipulation. The accusations include disturbing audio clips and screenshots of messages, sparking outrage online. @pandaninjaxxofficial described feeling emotionally discarded and used, while CoryxKenshin has yet to release an official statement, leaving fans in disbelief and demanding answers.

title: Pune Porsche crash case: 17-year-old accused to be tried as minor; JJB rejects police plea
content: The Juvenile Justice Board (JJB) has denied the Pune Police's request to try a 17-year-old involved in a fatal Porsche crash as an adult. The teenager, accused of driving under the influence and causing the death of two IT professionals in May 2024, will remain under the juvenile justice system.

title: History repeats? Bashir to Siraj feels like Mushtaq to Srinath
content: Anil Kumble lauded the thrilling Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy despite India's narrow loss at Lord's, emphasizing the series' compelling nature. He highlighted the fine margins that decided the match, such as Pant's run-out and extras conceded.

title: Axiom-4: Shux, crew exit Grace after splashdown - here’s how recovery happened
content: As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, its rolling out reels and reels of tales. If the first post office or a telephone connection paints one colour, the Stamp of a stock market scam or the ‘Jewel Thieves’ scandal paint yet another colour. If failure of a sounding rocket was a stepping stone, sending 104 satellites in one go was a podium. If farmer suicides are a bad climax, growing number of Unicorns are a grand entry. Chethan Kumar, Senior Assistant Editor, The Times of India, who alternates between the mundane goings-on of the hoi polloi and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and Jawans, feels: There’s always a story, one just has to find it. Read More

title: Christian McCaffrey and Olivia Culpo announce birth of first child with joint post
content: Christian McCaffrey  and Olivia Culpo welcomed their first child. The  San Francisco 49ers  star running back and former Miss Universe announced the news in a joint Instagram post on Sunday. The black-and-white photo collage included images of the couple in the delivery room as well each of them cradling their baby. McCaffrey and Culpo  announced in March  that they were expecting. A post shared by Olivia Frances Culpo (@oliviaculpo) "Colette Annalise McCaffrey" the couple wrote together on Instagram. Culpo posted a photo of McCaffrey with their baby on her Instagram story, captioning it: "Colette is so lucky to have the best daddy in the world. A love like no other." She also added a photo of McCaffrey consoling Culpo while in the delivery room, writing: "The scariest and most rewarding of all experiences. As soon as he came into the room I felt most at peace." McCaffrey and Culpo  married in June 2024 .

content: Cal Raleigh becomes the first catcher to win the 2025 home run Derby . the Seattle Mariners slugger outlasted junior Caminero . it was a power-packed night in Atlanta as oneil Cruz hit a ball a whopping 513 feet .

title: Can Brian Kelly and LSU win it all?
content: coach Brian Kelly has worked at lSU for more than 35 years . he will join Nick Saban, Les Miles and Ed Orgeron as a national champion . the team has a unique focus taking hold in the weight room .

title: Buzz: Hansen impresses, Wemby returns and storylines to watch
content: 2025 summer league has been filled with exciting rookie debuts . players looking to secure roster spots and chatter surrounding the season's biggest storylines . our insiders have been on site talking to front office staff and scouts as the future of the league performs ahead of 2025-26 .

title: First impressions of the rookie class and other key notes
content: the 2025 draft class hit the floor over the weekend at Las Vegas Summer League . no. 1 pick Cooper Flagg went for 31 points against no. 2 pick Dylan Harper and the San Antonio Spurs . sources confirmed to ESPN's Tim MacMahon that the Mavs will be shutting down Flagg .

title: Who are the NFL's best off-ball linebackers? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank the top 10
content: ESPN surveyed league executives, coaches and scouts to help us rank the top 10 players at 11 different positions . this is the sixth edition of these rankings, and as usual, several players moved up or fell off last year's lists . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position .
